components.description: ArchletteIR aggregation utilities | Extraction stage of the AAC pipeline | TypeScript/JavaScript code extractor | Cloudflare Wrangler deployment extractor
components.name: extractors

components.description: Validation stage of the AAC pipeline | Base IR validator for Archlette pipeline
components.name: validators

components.description: Generation stage of the AAC pipeline | Structurizr DSL Generator
components.name: generators

components.description: Render stage of the AAC pipeline | PlantUML image renderer | Structurizr DSL export renderer
components.name: renderers

components.description: Documentation stage of the AAC pipeline | Markdown documentation generator
components.name: docs

components.description: Dynamic ESM module loader | Stage module interfaces for the AAC pipeline | Stage module loaders | Tool management for external rendering tools | Architecture-as-Code (AAC) configuration types and schemas | Archlette Intermediate Representation (IR) types and schemas | Core pipeline types
components.name: core

code.description: Aggregate multiple ArchletteIR objects into a single unified IR
code.name: extractors::aggregateIRs

documentation.summary: Aggregate multiple ArchletteIR objects into a single unified IR
remarks:
- If the input array is empty, returns a minimal valid IR
- System metadata is taken from the first IR
- Elements are deduplicated by ID (first occurrence wins)
- Relationships are deduplicated by source+destination+stereotype combination

code.returnDescription: A single aggregated ArchletteIR with deduplicated elements

parameters.name: irs
parameters.description: - Array of ArchletteIR objects to merge

code.description: Deduplicate array of entities by their ID field
code.name: extractors::deduplicateById

documentation.summary: Deduplicate array of entities by their ID field
remarks:
When duplicate IDs are found, their descriptions are concatenated with ' | ' separator.
Duplicate descriptions are automatically filtered out.

code.returnDescription: Array with duplicates removed (first occurrence preserved, descriptions merged)

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: - Array of entities with id property

code.description: Deduplicate array of entities by their name field
code.name: extractors::deduplicateByName

documentation.summary: Deduplicate array of entities by their name field
remarks:
When duplicate names are found, their descriptions are concatenated with ' | ' separator.
Duplicate descriptions are automatically filtered out.

code.returnDescription: Array with duplicates removed (first occurrence preserved, descriptions merged)

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: - Array of entities with name property

code.description: Deduplicate relationships by source+destination+stereotype combination
code.name: extractors::deduplicateRelationships

documentation.summary: Deduplicate relationships by source+destination+stereotype combination
remarks:
Two relationships are considered duplicates if they have the same:
- source ID
- destination ID
- stereotype (undefined stereotypes are treated as distinct from defined ones)
The first occurrence is preserved, including its description.
This allows multiple relationships between the same elements with different stereotypes.

code.description:
Core path resolver honoring Archlette rules (no file existence checks).
- "~"  -> user home
- "/"  -> absolute
- else -> relative to CLI dir
code.name: core::resolveArchlettePath

documentation.summary:
Core path resolver honoring Archlette rules (no file existence checks).
- "~"  -> user home
- "/"  -> absolute
- else -> relative to CLI dir

code.description:
Resolve a module entry by probing:
1) Exact path
2) With extensions: .ts then .js
3) If directory: index.ts then index.js
code.name: core::resolveModuleEntry

documentation.summary:
Resolve a module entry by probing:
1) Exact path
2) With extensions: .ts then .js
3) If directory: index.ts then index.js

code.description: Generate Structurizr DSL from ArchletteIR
code.name: generators::structurizrGenerator

documentation.summary: Generate Structurizr DSL from ArchletteIR

parameters.name: _node
parameters.description: - Configuration node (unused but required by interface)

code.description:
Generate all actor-related relationships (bidirectional)

Includes:
1. Actor → Component (from actor.targets) - users interacting with system
2. Component → Actor (from componentRelationships) - system using external actors

Structurizr automatically aggregates relationships in views:
- System Context view: Shows as actor ↔ system
- Container view: Shows as actor ↔ container
- Component view: Shows actual actor ↔ component relationships
code.name: generators::generateAllActorRelationships

documentation.summary:
Generate all actor-related relationships (bidirectional)

Includes:
1. Actor → Component (from actor.targets) - users interacting with system
2. Component → Actor (from componentRelationships) - system using external actors

Structurizr automatically aggregates relationships in views:
- System Context view: Shows as actor ↔ system
- Container view: Shows as actor ↔ container
- Component view: Shows actual actor ↔ component relationships

code.returnDescription: Array of relationships to include in the model

parameters.name: ir
parameters.description: - The ArchletteIR containing actors and components

code.description: Generate the model section of the DSL
code.name: generators::generateModel

documentation.summary: Generate the model section of the DSL

code.description: Generate the views section of the DSL
code.name: generators::generateViews

documentation.summary: Generate the views section of the DSL

code.description:
Generate System Context view

Shows actors and the system boundary. Structurizr automatically aggregates
actor → component relationships to actor → system for this view since
components are not explicitly included.
code.name: generators::generateSystemContextView

documentation.summary:
Generate System Context view

Shows actors and the system boundary. Structurizr automatically aggregates
actor → component relationships to actor → system for this view since
components are not explicitly included.

code.description:
Generate Container view

Shows actors, containers, and their relationships. Actor → component
relationships are automatically aggregated to actor → container level
by Structurizr since components are not shown in this view.
code.name: generators::generateContainerView

documentation.summary:
Generate Container view

Shows actors, containers, and their relationships. Actor → component
relationships are automatically aggregated to actor → container level
by Structurizr since components are not shown in this view.

code.description:
Generate Component view for a container (excludes Code elements)

Shows actors, components within the container, and their relationships.
Actor → component relationships are shown explicitly at this level.
Code elements are excluded to keep the view focused on architecture.
code.name: generators::generateComponentView

documentation.summary:
Generate Component view for a container (excludes Code elements)

Shows actors, components within the container, and their relationships.
Actor → component relationships are shown explicitly at this level.
Code elements are excluded to keep the view focused on architecture.

code.description:
Generate Class view for a component (only Code elements within that component)
This supports the drill-down model: System → Container → Component → Code

Note: Component views in Structurizr require a container ID, not a component ID.
We use the component's container and filter to show only this component's code.
code.name: generators::generateClassView

documentation.summary:
Generate Class view for a component (only Code elements within that component)
This supports the drill-down model: System → Container → Component → Code

Note: Component views in Structurizr require a container ID, not a component ID.
We use the component's container and filter to show only this component's code.

code.description:
Map wrangler configurations to ArchletteIR

This creates:
- Containers: One per wrangler.toml file
- Deployments: One per environment (production, dev, preview, etc.)
- Container Instances: One per container per environment
- Container Relationships: Logical dependencies from service bindings
- Deployment Relationships: Physical instance-to-instance connections
code.name: mapToIR

documentation.summary:
Map wrangler configurations to ArchletteIR

This creates:
- Containers: One per wrangler.toml file
- Deployments: One per environment (production, dev, preview, etc.)
- Container Instances: One per container per environment
- Container Relationships: Logical dependencies from service bindings
- Deployment Relationships: Physical instance-to-instance connections

code.description:
Extract containers from wrangler configurations

Creates one container per wrangler.toml file.
Each container represents a Cloudflare Worker.
code.name: extractContainers

documentation.summary:
Extract containers from wrangler configurations

Creates one container per wrangler.toml file.
Each container represents a Cloudflare Worker.

code.description:
Normalize service bindings from various formats

Wrangler supports multiple binding formats:
- [[services]] array (TOML array of tables)
- services = [{ binding = "...", service = "..." }]

documentation.summary:
Normalize service bindings from various formats

Wrangler supports multiple binding formats:
- [[services]] array (TOML array of tables)
- services = [{ binding = "...", service = "..." }]

code.description:
Get all environments from a wrangler config

Returns a list of environment names, including:
- "production" (from root-level config if it has deployable content)
- All keys from env.* sections
code.name: getEnvironments

Get all environments from a wrangler config

Returns a list of environment names, including:
- "production" (from root-level config if it has deployable content)
- All keys from env.* sections

code.description:
Get configuration for a specific environment

Merges root-level config with environment-specific overrides.
Environment config takes precedence.

Get configuration for a specific environment

Merges root-level config with environment-specific overrides.
Environment config takes precedence.
